text:
Bayfront Station: Singapore's subterranean crossroads of adventure and leisure. More than just an interchange connecting the Downtown (DT16, blue) and Circle (CE1, yellow) lines, this is the epicenter for accessing Singapore's crown jewels. Gardens by the Bay, Marina Bay Sands, and the tantalizing casinos all converge here, making it a predictably popular hub.  Brace yourself for the energetic flow of tourists, particularly during peak hours and weekends.

However, beyond the bustling platforms lies a surprisingly elegant and meticulously maintained path leading towards the botanical artistry of Gardens by the Bay. This station isn't just functional, it's a key that unlocks the magic of Marina Bay.
One of the most used stations by tourists, accessible to Gardens by the Bay, MBS casino and mall. Station isn't deep, so not a lot of escalators

This Station serve as the interchange station to the Downtown and Circle Lines. Marina Bay Sands is located beside the MRT station. You can also alight this station to go to Garden by the Bay.

This station is crowded during weekend and grand events that held in Singapore like F1.

Another clean efficient metro station.  Particularly useful if staying at or visiting Marina Bay Sands.

Singapore Metro's so cheap, I was always waiting for my ticket to run out but it never did.

Good MRT interchange MRT Station, you can get to Gardens by the Bay, MBS Shoppes or Hotel / IR from this station.

Clean and neat, and staff here are used to dealing with tourists. However, I feel the station is a little dim.
